description: Number of legal tic-tac-toe (or noughts and crosses) positions after n plays, up to rotation and reflection.
comments: As in chess, a "play" is an action by a single player, a "move" is two contiguous plays by each opponent.
links: Index entries for sequences related to tic-tac-toe
example: Example: a(2) = 12 since after 2 plays there are 12 legal positions:-x- -x- -x- -x- -o- x-- x-- x-- x-o xo- o-- ox---- --- -o- o-- -x- --- --o -o- --- --- -x- ----o- o-- --- --- --- --o --- --- --- --- --- ---
author: _Russ Cox_
extensions: Additional comments from _David W. Wilson_, Jun 03 2001
